channel.title: I2C hotplugging
channel.description:
Hi all,
I have 3 I2C modules (2x MPR121 and 1xOLED) connected to my core. One of them is a detachable (by RJ45 plug) mini piano (using the 2 MPR121's). I have noticed that if I have not connected the plug before booting the Axoloti Core, the piano is not working. I was wondering whether there is a method of 're-triggering' or 're-initializing' I2C after the core has been powered on. This would allow me to disconnect the piano during a performance and connect it to a another core. I can imagine this is an architectural limitation... Anybody any opinions on this? Thanks!
